## Example HTML (generated by Elementor):

<div class="popup-close elementor-widget elementor-widget-button">
  <a class="elementor-button" href="#">
    <span class="elementor-button-text">MAYBE LATER</span>
  </a>
</div>


‚ö†Ô∏è The clickable element is the <a> tag, not the wrapper div.


## JavaScript Implementation

Add the following JavaScript to Elementor ‚Üí Custom Code, or your theme‚Äôs footer.

document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function () {
  document.body.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
    const trigger = e.target.closest('.popup-close a');
    if (!trigger) return;

    e.preventDefault();

    const popup = trigger.closest('.elementor-popup-modal');
    if (!popup) return;

    const dialogClose = popup.querySelector('.dialog-close-button');
    if (dialogClose) {
      dialogClose.click();
    }
  });
});

## How It Works
Elementor popups are controlled by Dialog.js
The popup wrapper is .elementor-popup-modal
The official close trigger is .dialog-close-button
Clicking that button runs Elementor‚Äôs full cleanup process
This script simply:
Detects a click on your custom button
Finds the active popup
Triggers Elementor‚Äôs native close logic
No hacks. No side effects.

**Button ‚Üí Link ‚Üí Dynamic ‚Üí Popup ‚Üí Close Popup**
